Description:
Verify basic write operation on port A
Write random data and address
Verify the data is written on the memory
Name: write_a

Description:
Verify basic write operation on port B
Write random data and address
Verify the data is written on the memory
Name: write_b

Description:
Verify basic read operation on port A
Read data from a random address via port A
Verify the output is same as stored data
Name: read_a

Description:
Verify basic read operation on port B
Read data from a random address via port B
Verify the output is same as stored data
Name: read_b

Description:
Verify basic write and read operations on port A
Write random data and address
Read from the same address
Verify that read data equals previously written data
Name: write_read_a
Bugs:
* ready_a is high but rd_data_a shows XXXX. seems like memory's data output isn't working right.
* The memory has 1 cycle read delay, ready=1, valid = 1 but data comes next cycle.

Description:
Verify basic write and read operations on port B
Write random data and address
Read from the same address
Verify that read data equals previously written data
Name: write_read_b

Case: Write port A Read port B
Description:
Ensure data consistency between all the ports
Write random data to any address via port A
Read the same address via port B
The output should be the same as the input
Name: write_a_read_b

Case: Write port B Read port A
Description:
Ensure data consistency between all the ports
Write random data to any address via port B
Read the same address via port A
The output should be the same input
Name: write_b_read_a

Description:
Ensure memory supports overwriting same address
Write random data on the same address multiple times
The stored data should change with each write operation
Name: write_same_address

Description:
Ensure the defaul output of an empty memory
Read from empty address (never written) 
Expect output to be zero
Name: empty_mem_read

Description:
Ensure all addresses are accessible 
Fill all memory locations with data
Verify all addresses changed to the new value
Name: fill_memory

Description:
Ensure reset functionality works well
Test reading from memory immediately after reset
The output should be zero or default value and verify that writes after reset behave as expected
Name: reset_behavior

Description:
Ensure write operation is independent for each port
Write random data on different addresses from different ports at the same time
Both succeed
Name: simultaneous_write

Description:
Ensure read operation is independent for each port 
Read random data on different addresses from different ports at the same time
Both get the right data
Name: simultaneous_read

Case:
Simultaneous Write Port A Read Port B
(same address)
Description:
Ensure the read value is the new one when port A write and port B read at the same time
Write a random data to an address via port A
Read the same address at the same time via port B
Expected to get the new data
Name: sim_write_a_read_b

Case:
Simultaneous Write Port B Read Port A
(same address)
Description:
Ensure the read value is the new one when port B write and port A read at the same time
Write a random data to an address via port B
Read the same address at the same time via port A
Expected to get the new data
Name: sim_write_b_read_a
Bugs: * When port B writes and port A reads same address simultaneously, port A gets old value instead of new one.

Description:
Verify the arbitration logic is valid when different ports write at the same adderess in the same time
Write to the same address from different ports at the same time
Check which one wins
Name: write_collision

Description:
Ensure the consistency of memory when two ports read at the same adderess in the same time
Read from the same address from different ports at the same time
Name: read_collision

Description:
Verify out of range access handling in memory
Access a random address out of memory range ( address > MEMORY_SIZE)
Check if it doesn't corrupt data in other addresses
Name: out_of_range_access
Bugs: * Out of-range memory access is corrupting valid addresses.

Case: Back to Back Writes Port A
Description:
Ensure that memory can handle continuous write operations from port A
Write random data on random addresses consecutive cycles via port A
Verify the addresses changed to the new value
Name: back_to_back_writes_a

Case: Back to Back Writes Port B
Description:
Ensure that memory can handle continuous write operations from port B
Write random data on random addresses consecutive cycles via port B
Verify the addresses changed to the new value
Name: back_to_back_writes_b

Description:
Ensure that memory can handle continuous write operations from different ports
Write random data on random addresses consecutive cycles via port B and port A
Verify the addresses changed to the new value
Name: back_to_back_writes

Case: Back to Back Reads Port A
Description:
Ensure that memory can handle continuous read operations from from port A
Read random data on random addresses consecutive cycles via port A
It gets the right data
Name: back_to_back_reads_a

Case: Back to Back Reads Port B
Description:
Ensure that memory can handle continuous read operations from port B
Read random data on random addresses consecutive cycles via port B
It gets the right data
Name: back_to_back_reads_b

Description:
Ensure that memory can handle continuous read operations from different ports
Read random data on random addresses consecutive cycles via port B and port A
It gets the right data
Name: back_to_back_reads

Description:
Ensure that memory can handle continuous transactions from different ports
Random operation read or write
check if the operations were done successfully
Name: back_to_back_transactions

Description:
Ensure all addresses accessible, no wraparound
Write/read address MIN_SIZE, MAX_SIZE,
Name: address_boundaries

Description:
Ensure delays won't affect different operations on the memory
Write data to a random addess
Wait for a few cycles 
Read data from the same address
Read data should match the written one
Name: delays
